citation.article-title: Description of a new species, Bifidobacterium crudilactis sp. nov., isolated from raw milk and raw milk cheeses

p.s: Description of Bifidobacterium crudilactis sp. nov.
Bifidobacterium crudilactis (cru.di.lac’tis L. adj. crudus, raw, not cooked; L. n. lac lactis, milk; N.L. gen. n. crudilactis, of raw milk)
The cells are Gram-positive, non-spore-forming bacilli.
They are irregularly shaped rods, curved, arranged singly, with occasional bifurcations and spatulated extremities, and 0.5×1.5–2.5 μm in size in 24 h TPY cultures.
Colonies on TPY agar at 39 °C under anaerobic conditions are cream, circular, and convex with whole edges.
They reach a diameter of up to 1 mm within 48 h.
They have a reduced diameter (less than 1 mm) under aerobic conditions within the same time.
Optimum growth temperature for the ten strains is 39 °C, with a maximum of 45 °C (within 8 days) and a minimum of 5 °C (4 °C for three strains, within 14 days).
FR62/b/3T is able to grow at 4 °C.
In TPY, the minimum initial pH for growth of FR62/b/3T is 4.7 (within 48 h; weak growth at pH 4.4 within 15 days and not at pH 3.8).
All ten strains of B. crudilactis (⩾90% of the strains) ferment ribose, galactose, glucose, fructose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, raffinose, and d-turanose.

None ferment (⩽10% of the strains) glycerol, erythritol, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-xylose, l-xylose, adonitol, β-methyl-xyloside, d-mannose, l-sorbose, rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, α-methyl-d-glucoside, N-acetyl-glucosamine, trehalose, inulin, melezitose, starch, glygogen, xylitol, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, gluconate, 2-keto-gluconate, and 5-keto-gluconate.

All strains (⩾90% of the strains) were positive for α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, arginine arylamidase, proline arylamidase, phenylalanine arylamidase, leucine arylamidase, tyrosine arylamidase, glycine arylamidase, and histidine arylamidase.

All were negative (⩽10% of the strains) for urease, indole production, nitrate reduction, arginine dihydrolase, β-galactosidase-6-phosphate, α-arabinosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-N-acetyl-glucosaminidase, glutamic decarboxylase acid, α-fucosidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, and glutamyl arylamidase.
Strains were isolated from raw milks and raw milk cheeses.
The origin of the raw milk contamination was not known.
The mean DNA G+C content for ten strains is 55.3 mol% (SD=0.82).
The DNA G+C content of FR62/b/3T is 56.4 mol%.
The type strain is FR62/b/3T (=LMG 23609T=CNCM I-3342T), isolated from raw cow milk in France.
